intro: Carelia petiolata, commonly known as the slender carelia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Carelia petiolata is typically found in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil.
